summary:
Gender Team Lead and Senior Gender Advisor at KIT Royal Tropical Institute in Amsterdam. With a background in resource management, international development and the management of agricultural knowledge systems, Rhiannon's focus lies in gender equality in agricultural and environmental research and development. For 25 years, Rhiannon has worked on gender dynamics in agricultural development, agricultural innovation systems, social and environmental standards and certification, and social learning, as well as cross-cultural and development education. 

Over the past 8 years, Rhiannon’s work has focused on supporting international agricultural and environmental research institutes, specifically CGIAR Research Programs (CRPs) and Centers, with gender analysis, gender research and the institutional change needed to support gender integration and tranformatie change. She acted as interim Gender Research Coordinator for the CRP on Livestock and Fish (2014-2016), integrating gender analysis into technical, systems and value chain research, distilling entry points for institutionalizing gender research and integrating gender into a next phase proposal. From 2017-2019 she coordinated the CGIAR Collaborative Platform for Gender Research, which was housed in the CRP on Policies, Institutions, and Markets (PIM), led by the International Food Policy Research Institute (IFPRI). She supported the development of a system-wide gender research agenda, profiling and making visible the gender research of the CGIAR system’s 12 research programs and 15 Centers. In 2020 and 2021, Rhiannon was granted support from the NL-CGIAR partnership in the Senior Expert  to work with IFPRI in PIM’s gender flagship, supporting and coordinating cross-system gender research. As part of the that work, she co-edited a system-wide book on CGIAR gender research entitled: Advancing gender equality through agricultural and environmental research – past, present and future (Pyburn & Eerdewijk eds 2021). 

Rhiannon has a proven track record as a skilled and dynamic facilitator, analytical thinker and a good writer. She works well both independently and in collaboration with a team and is a natural partnership builder and networker. She is an excellent research manager and her strengths lie in pulling our higher level research for development questions across diverse gender research areas. She writes and publishes extensively (working papers, books and peer-reviewed articles).

profile_positions.description:
Lead a team of 11 Gender Advisors (junior medior and senior) as well as interns and coordinates and makes links to gender work done across KIT Gender in other teams in KIT's Knowledge Unit of Sustainable Exconomic Development and Gender (SEDG) and Health. As Gender Team Lead, Rhiannon manages the human resources of the team, including recruitment, performance reviews, team-well-being, professional development, and development of the team's knowledge agenda. She works with the team to ensure high quality knowledge outputs and a robust and exciting work portfolio. 

1) Facilitates and monitors team performance on team targets, approves project budget and makes decisions on acquisition

2) Supervising project leadership, performance (finance, impact and client satisfaction) and quality control (ISO standard and other quality measures).

3) Human resource management (coaching and professional development, performance reviews, well-being and work pressure, recruitment of new staff and onboarding)

4) Strategic planning (financial, acquisition and knowledge strategy, impact, annual strategy implementation, team building and cross-team collaboration, annual unit plan development and monitoring, contribute to approval of proposals for KIT's Knowledge Investment Fund - KIF, understand and act on strategic opportunities in the market, collaborate with other team leads)
profile_positions.title: Gender Team Lead

profile_positions.description:
Since July 2008 I have worked at KIT Royal Tropical Institue intially as an Advisor (2008-2009) and then as Senior Advisor (2010-present): now I am also Gender Team Lead at KIT. I have done a wide range of work at KIT, involving for 7 years, full engagement with CGIAR partners on gender research management. 

In general, as a KIT Senior Advisor, my role is to generate and systematize knowledge related  to inclusion, gender equality, smallholders and environmental sustainability in agricultural value chains and innovation systems. Facilitation and capacity building as well as action-research, analysis and documentation.

Main duties:
- Generate and systematize knowledge through, for example, case study documentation
- Facilitate meetings, workshops, seminars and panels with a wide range of stakeholders
- Action-research on key knowledge questions
- Communicate knowledge in accessible and dynamic ways to different audiences (e.g. through    films, books and online interactive communities, portals and books)

Action-research, writing, facilitation and consulting on the following topics, amongst others:
-Gender equality in agricultural and environmental research for development
-Social and environmental certification and standards (e.g. FairTrade, organic, Rainforest Alliance, Utz)
-Gender integration into global standards
-Gender dynamics in value chain development
-Dynamics of Rural Innovation

Responsibilities of significant CGIAR collaborations are elaborated as separate positions given my time was fully accounted for in that work, over a period of 5-7 years.
profile_positions.title: Senior Advisor Gender and Agriculture

profile_positions.location: KIT Royal Tropical Institute, Amsterdam Area, Netherlands
profile_positions.description: The Senior Senior Expert Programme (SEP) is one of the three instruments in the Netherlands – CGIAR research programme. Through the SEP, I worked with the International Food Policy Research Institute (IFPRI)-lead CGIAR Research Program on Policies, Institutions and Markets (PIM), building on work begun when I coordinated CGIAR Collaborative Platform for Gender Research.  I continued to be based at KIT Royal Tropical Institute but was fully engaged with IFPRI and CGIAR gender researchers internationally.
profile_positions.title: Senior Expert, CGIAR Research Program on Policies, Institutions, and Markets (PIM)

profile_positions.description: CGIAR Collaborative Platform for Gender Research was housed in the CGIAR Research Program on Policies, Institutions, and Markets (PIM) and served all 12 CGIAR research programs. It aimed to increase the visibility and impact of gender research undertaken across CGIAR. The Platform supported priority setting for gender research, strategic partnerships, capacity development, and collaboration between and among CGIAR programs, Centers, and partners, building on the work of system-wide gender network established in 2011. As Platform Coordinator, I was based at the Royal Tropical Institute (KIT) in Amsterdam, supported by a communications team.
profile_positions.title: Coordinator - CGIAR Collaborative Platform for Gender Research (CRP PIM)

profile_positions.description:
Concurrent with doctoral research, Rhiannon worked as an independent consultant on related assignments building her profile internationally and ensuring that the scientific work was plugged into on-going, real-life development practice.  

Selected assignments:
-Capacity Development and Institutional Change Program - Wageningen International. Prepared Annual Review 2006-2007 (December 2006-May 2007)

-International Development Research Centre (IDRC) via Learning by Design. Review of Capacity Building in IDRC-Supported Networks. Analysis and report-writing (April-October 2006)

-International Federation of Organic Agriculture Movements European Group (IFOAM EU). Coordination and analysis of changes to the EU Regulation on Organic Production and Processing, compiling member state comments on the changes and facilitating input (March 2006-September 2006)

-Wageningen University Wetenschap Winkel. Sustainable Cotton Project with Goede Waar & Co. Author of the chapter on social issues related to cotton production and processing (August-December 2005)
	
-Forest Stewardship Council. Revision of group and multiple office certification, and Chain of Custody standard requirements (August-October 2005)

-ISEAL Alliance. Led participatory project proposal development process (January-June 2005)
	
-ISEAL Alliance. Comparison of member organisation and other practices vis à vis small players (foresters, fisherfolk, farmers), Internal Control Systems (ICSs) / group certification (June 2004-January 2005)
	
-SASA Project. Wrote final report on smallholders and Internal Control Systems (February-June 2004)

-Learning by Design. Evaluated the Dutch HIVOS/OXFAM-NOVIB Biodiversity Fund (February-May 2004)

-Agromisa Foundation. Workshops on Rapid Appraisal of Agricultural Knowledge Systems (2002, 2003)

-International Agriculture Centre. Plant Breeding and Biotechnology course contribution (May 2003)

- SLIM Project (2002).
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Concurrent to doctoral research and independent consulting, Rhiannon also did English and content editing work related to her fields of interest. 

Main asignments:
-Communication and Innovation Studies, Wageningen University. English and scientific content editing of over 35 papers and reports for publication, Jan 2002-March 2008

-Capacity Development & Institutional Change Program - Wageningen International. Promotional brochure for LNV-funded Policy Support Cluster International Programme, Dec 2007-Feb 2008

-Agri-Profocus, Agriterra. Producer Organisations. English editing for 18 chapter book, June-July 2007

-Learning By Design. Translation from French, and English editing of the Report on the Programme Evaluation “Assessing Civil Society Participation as supported by HIVOS, CordAid, NOVIB and PLAN-NL” Guinea Country Report, Oct 2005

-FAO book on Integrated Pest Management (IPM), English editing for book editors, Jan/Feb 2003

-Wageningen University. Wheelbarrows Full of Frogs – Social Learning in Rural Resource Management. English and scientific content editing – 50 international authors, 30 chapters, Jan-Jun 2002
profile_positions.title: Editor - Academic and English language

profile_positions.description:
PhD thesis on Social and Environmental Certification for small farmers in developing countries - Internal Control Systems as a learning mechanism. Prepared a proposal and carried out field research and writing as a PhD candidate looking at smallholder certification to international social and environmental standards as an institutional innovation; particularly the learning dimension of group certification.

Main achievements:
-Developed and implemented action research with the International Social and Environmental Accreditation and Labelling Alliance (ISEAL) on smallholder certification in developing countries
-Documented five cases on small farmer group certification in Brazil (organic FairTrade orange juice), Costa Rica (certified coffee), Thailand (organic FairTrade rice), Burkina Faso (organic FairTrade mangoes) and Uganda (organic FairTrade cotton)
-Dissertation working title: Reflexive Certification – social and environmental standard-setters and smallholder farmers in developing countries
-Findings from field research were immediately taken up in practice through the ISEAL Alliance and its partners

Freelance consulting on related issues.
profile_positions.title: PhD Researcher

profile_positions.description: Course curriculum development, selection of course material, examination preparation and grading for a course entitled: Innovation Management and Cross-Disciplinary Design. This was for the Department of Communication and Innovation Studies, Social Sciences.
profile_positions.title: Academic Researcher

profile_positions.description: Co-edited (for English and content) and coordinated the contributions of over 50 authors for an academic publication entitled: Wheel Barrows full of frogs: social learning in rural resource management.
profile_positions.title: Editor /Coordinator - Wheelbarrows Full of Frogs

profile_positions.description: Canada World Youth is a Canadian development and cultural education youth exchange program operating internationally. Rhiannon developed, set-up and lead international cultural exchanges between Canadian and Indonesian youth aged 17-28, in rural Canadian and Indonesian communities. She met with community leaders to set-up work and home placements  and coordinated the non-formal education of the participants involved both in Canada and in Indonesia.
profile_positions.title: Project Supervisor BC-Indonesia Exchange

profile_positions.description: Taught French at the Steiner-inspired farm school for children aged 5-8. General farm work on the organic farm, including milk/cheese production and all sheep-realted activities (care, spinning and weaving wool), working in the community-supported agriculture garden and root crop operations.
profile_positions.title: French teacher and organic farm worker

profile_positions.description: Katimavik is a Canadian youth environmental education and life skills development program for 17-21 year olds.  As project leader, Rhiannon developed non-formal education programs for participants and worked with the community to ensure enriching volunteer assignments for this Francophone rotation for participants.
profile_positions.title: Project Leader

profile_positions.description: Developed and undertook research exploring traditional agricultural techniques (without external inputs) amongst women and youth in Ivorian villages as part of an IDRC-funded internship.
profile_positions.title: Development Research Intern
